info.title: GetID API
info.description:
# Overview

The GetID API allows you to send applications for verification and receive the results.
Verification results for applications created using our SDKs can also be obtained through the API.

A verification consists of one or more "checks".
Different checks require different sets of an applicant's data.

# Authentication

The GetID API uses token-based authentication. 
API tokens must be included in the header of all requests made to the API.

<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Application
tags.description:
"Application" is the basic concept used in this API.
It is a set of data that have to be verified, is being verified or has already been verified.

It may contain text data of the applicant's profile, image(s) of his/her identity document, selfie of the applicant, as well as additional files.
Also, if the application was created using our SDK, it may contain artefacts confirm that the applicant passes the liveness check.

tags.name: Token
tags.description:
One can create a token to avoid using the API key in requests.
The API key have full access to all methods and data.
So using tokens with limited access is preferable for security reasons.

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Is used to specify instructions for caching mechanisms.

parameters.name: X-Signature
parameters.description:
The request body concatenated with the `X-Timestamp` header, signed by the private key.
This signature can be used to validate that the sender is GetID.
See more details in the Webhooks section of the Administrative Portal.

get.description: Retrieves a previously submitted application by providing its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a previously submitted application by providing its ID.

get.summary: Get an application in PDF format
get.description: Retrieves a previously submitted application in PDF format.

post.description:
Creates a one-time verification link.

An end user, by following the created link, will be able to submit an application for verification using our SDK.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
The name of the verification flow. 
You can create, view, edit and delete verification flows in the Administrative Portal.

APIKeyAuth.name: X-API-Key
APIKeyAuth.description:
Your API key can be used as a token. 
The API key can be found in the Settings section of the Administrative Portal.

The API key provides access to all submitted applications, so keep it in safety. Never use the API key in the frontend side of your system.

APITokenAuth.name: X-API-Key
APITokenAuth.description:
Tokens created using the `POST api/v1/token` method give access only to applications created using the very same token.

Such tokens can be deleted using `DELETE api/v1/token/{token}` method, for example, if a token has been compromised or when staff members with access to a token leave your organisation.

Note: tokens with `root` access level provide access to all submitted applications.

schema.description: array of userNames, available option "No author" - returns applications without author

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized access, invalid or missing authorization header.

ApplicationToVerifyContainer.description: The data that GetID accepts as input to perform the verification.

ExternalID.description:
A unique identifier.
You can use it to link an application with a user in your system.

MetadataLabels.description: A set of arbitrary key-value pairs. The maximum amount of keys is 30.

allOf.description:
The profile data of the applicant.

It must be provided and must contain "First name", "Last name" and "Date of birth" fields to perform a `watchlists` check.

documents.description:
The applicant's ID document.

It must be provided to perform `data-extraction` and `face-matching` checks.

selfie.description:
The applicant's selfie.

It must be provided to perform a `face-matching` check.

ProfileDataFields.description: The profile data of the applicant.

category.description:
The name of the field.

The naming convention for field names is "the first word is capitalised, others are lowercased".

content.description:
The value of the field.

The format of the value depends on its `category`.

Dates must be in YYYY-MM-DD format.
The "Gender" field can take only two values: `male`, `female`.
Country fields must be in ISO 3166-1 [alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3#Officially_assigned_code_elements) format.
Other fields are plain strings.

files.description: A photo of the main page of the document or two photos of both sides of a double-sided document.

IssuingCountryCode.description: The code of the issuing country of the document. Format: ISO 3166-1 [alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3#Officially_assigned_code_elements))

DocumentPageKind.description:
A page of the document.
* `front` is the front side of a two-sided document or the only provided page of a document
* `back` is the back side of a two-sided document
* `single-page` is the main page of a document that has only one page required for verification (e.g. most countries' passports)

uri.description:
An image encoded to a base64 string.
Both JPEG and PNG images are acceptable.

DataExtraction.description: The data extraction from the provided document.

FaceMatching.description: The biometric comparison of the person in the selfie and the person in the ID document photo.

Watchlists.description: A detailed report of any records relevant to the applicant's profile data (First name, Last name, Date of birth) found during global AML watchlists' screening.

Liveness.description:
Identity check in live mode.
This check can be performed only if the GetID SDK was used for submitting the application.

VerificationTypesToPerform.description:
The list of checks requested.
If no list is set, then all types of checks that have been paid for will be performed.

applicationsListTotalItems.description: The total number of applications submitted.

applicationsList.description:
The list of submitted applications.
This field is omitted if the request contains `idsOnly=true`.

applicationsListIds.description:
The list of submitted applications' IDs.
This field exists if the request contains `idsOnly=true`.

VerificationResult.description: The data that GetID provides as output for each application submitted.

Metadata.description:
Meta information about the application.
Contains information passed with the application when submitting it using this API, or information added to the application by our SDK.
Also contains information added on our backend after receiving the application.

allOf.description: The value passed as `externalId` when submitting the application.
The set of arbitrary key-value pairs passed as `labels` when submitting the application.

platform.description:
The platform from which the application was submitted, if our SDK was used: `ios`, `android` or `web`.
Or, if the application was submitted using the `POST api/v1/application` method, then the value is `API`.
Also, the value can be `internal` if the application was submitted using an "internal flow" in Administrative Portal.

sdkVersion.description: The version of the SDK that was used for submitting the application.

allOf.description: The time when the application was created.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the end-user that submitted the application using our SDK.

country.description: The country from which the user submitted the application. Determined by the IP address.

city.description: The city from which the user submitted the application. Determined by the IP address.

userAgent.description: The user agent of the end-user that submitted the application using our SDK.
userAgent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/81.0.4044.122 Safari/537.36

author.description: The username or email of the Administrative Portal's user that submitted the application using an "internal flow".

createdBy.description:
The SDK that was used to submit the application.

This field is primarily needed to separate `web-mobile` and `web-desktop`, because all applications submitted using our Web SDK belongs to the `web` platform.

locale.description:
The locale of the end-user that submitted the application using our SDK.

Note: different platforms use different separators and some locales contain more than two components.
For example, `en_GB` or `zh-Hans-CN` are also valid values.

flowName.description:
The name of the verification flow, if our SDK was used.
Or the name of an "internal flow".

Application.description: The data that have been provided for verification.

documents.description: The ID document provided by the applicant.

selfie.description: Temporary links to media files with the applicant's face.

files.description: Temporary links to the photos of the ID document.

MediaURI.description: A temporary link to the media file.

FaceKind.description:
The type of a media file with the applicant's face.
* `selfie` is an image with a selfie of the applicant
* `liveness-video` is a video recorded during the applicant's liveness check
* `liveness-full-face` is an image taken during the liveness check

allOf.description:
Indicates whether the verification of this application has been completed.

* `processing` - the application is being processed
* `done` - the verification has been completed

Indicates whether the check has been completed.

* `processing` - the service is still performing the check
* `done` - the check has been completed

OverallResult.description:
The summary of the result of the verification.

Omitted while the `processingState` is `processing`.

comments.description: The list of checks performed and their brief results.

concerns.description: The list of all the issues found during all the checks.

comment.description: A brief comment on the result of the check.

allOf.description: The level of severity of the issue according to the current settings of the verification rules.

message.description: A brief description of the issue.
message.example: The photo is not a selfie.

Service.description: The name of the service performed the check.

ValidationDate.description: The date and time of completion of the validation.

allOf.description:
The worst result of all the checks performed.

A "check" in this context means checking a particular aspect of the application submitted.
All checks and their results can be found in `servicesResults` property of the verification result.

The worst result means the closest to the end of the following list: `approved`, `needs-review`, `declined`, `error`.

The result of most checks depends not only on the provided data, but also on the "verification rules" settings in the Administrative Portal.

NeedsReview.description: A problem detected which is not considered critical under the current settings of the verification rules.

Declined.description: A problem detected which is considered critical under the current settings of the verification rules.

Error.description: An error occurred, for example due to invalid input data.

ServiceResults.description: The list of checks performed and their full results.

DocCheckServiceResult.description: The result of the complex check of the provided ID document.

equal.description: Null means that the check between fields on the document was not performed

valid.description: The document field validation result (false means that value is incorrect)

documentId.description: The document ID from which extracted data is compared

ProfileCheckServiceResult.description: The result of the comparison of the applicant's profile data that was provided using this API or collected using our SDK with the data extracted from the ID document.

fieldChecking.description: The result of comparing the profile data and the data extracted from the document.

field.description: The value provided as profile data.

extracted.description: The value extracted from the ID document.

equal.description: Indicates whether the `field` and the `extracted` values are equal.

FaceMatchingServiceResult.description: The result of the biometric comparison of the person who takes a selfie and/or passes the liveness check and the person in the ID document photo.

settings.description:
The settings that determine the result of the check.
If both thresholds are equal, the `status` can only be `declined` or `approved`.

FaceMatchingResult.description: The result of the biometric comparison of the faces in the images provided.

files.description: The list of IDs of files participated in the comparison.

score.description: A number indicating the level of similarity of faces.

LivenessCheckServiceResult.description:
The result of the liveness check.

This check can only be performed using the GetID SDK.
It's not possible to perform this check submitting the application using the API.

LivenessCheckResult.description: The results of all the considerations related to the liveness check.

considers.description: The list of the considerations and their results.

ServiceResultVerifier.description: The name of the service performed the check.

ServiceResultComment.description: A brief description of the result of the check.

WatchlistsServiceResult.description: A detailed report of any records relevant to the applicant's profile data (First name, Last name, Date of birth) found during global AML watchlists' screening.

sentFields.description: A list of the profile data fields that have been used to search for records in the watchlists.

records.description: Records from AML watchlists can have any structure.

ContentType.description: A type of a profile data field content. Deprecated.

author.description: The login of the comment's author.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the comment's creation.

keyword.description: Describes the type of validation that wasn't passed. Examples: required, type, format, pattern.

dataPath.description: The path to the invalid data.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

allOf.description: A locale identifier. The SDK uses the specified locale as the default one.

profile.description: The profile data of the applicant.

redirects.description: URLs to redirect the user after completing the verification flow.

onComplete.description: A URL to redirect to if the user has successfully passed the verification flow.

onFail.description: A URL to redirect to if the user has not passed the verification flow.

TranslationDictionaryName.description: The name of a translations dictionary.

ttl.description: Time to live for the API token in seconds. The default value is 86400 (24 hours).

accessLevel.description: A token created with `root` access level can be used to retrieve any submitted application.
